channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here are some of the newest UNESCO World Heritage sites
item.description: Bavarian palaces, imperial tombs in China and memorials to Khmer Rouge victims are among the sites being recognized by the United Nations agency.

item.title: 'Fresh Air' goes out to the ballgame
item.description: After a memorable All-Star game, today we listen back to some favorite baseball interviews from the Fresh Air archives: conversations with Jamie Moyer...

item.title: 10 Americans are freed from Venezuela in a prisoner swap for migrants in El Salvador
item.description: Venezuela has freed 10 Americans in exchange for Venezuelans whom the United States had sent to a prison in El Salvador.

item.title: The Downstream Effects of China's Rare Earth Mining
item.description: China has nearly cornered the market in rare earth minerals, which are a necessary component to much of our technology today. But China sources some o...

item.title: Trump Asks Manhattan Court to Unseal Epstein Grand Jury Testimony
item.description: The president has been under intense political pressure from his base after Attorney General Pam Bondi withheld portions of investigative files on the...

item.title: Trump’s War With Powell Throws a Little-Known Planning Board Into Scrutiny
item.description: The National Capital Planning Commission has become pivotal in the administration’s campaign to discredit Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal R...

item.title: New U.S. Postal Service head says he doesn't believe in privatizing the mail agency
item.description: Postmaster General David Steiner told USPS workers he doesn't believe in privatizing the agency. President Trump has expressed support for such a move...

item.title: Explosion at Los Angeles Training Center Kills 3 Sheriff’s Deputies
item.description: It was not immediately clear what caused the blast at the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department’s Biscailuz Training Academy center. No one else was...

item.title: Cuban Minister Resigns After Accusing Beggars of Faking Poverty
item.description: The labor and social security minister drew public outrage when she said “there are no beggars” in Cuba, where many people struggle to afford food.

item.title: Bolsonaro, Brazil’s Former President, Ordered to Wear Ankle Monitor Before Trial

item.title: How a Video Studio Embraced A.I. and Stormed the Internet
item.description: The Dor Brothers are indie filmmakers whose viral videos are generated entirely by artificial intelligence.

item.title: Major Prisoner Swap Frees Americans in Venezuela for Migrants in El Salvador
item.description: A deal freed 10 Americans and permanent residents detained in Venezuela for more than 200 Venezuelan migrants who were imprisoned in El Salvador after...

item.title: Floods and Heavy Rain Kill Dozens in Pakistan
item.description: Relentless rain began on Wednesday, causing flooding in several cities and across vast rural stretches in the province of Punjab.
